1:
My spirit is consumed, and my days are over;\q the grave is ready for me.
\q
2:
Surely there are mockers with me;\q my eye must always see their provocation.
\m
\q
3:
Give now a pledge, be a guarantee for me with yourself;\q who else is there who will help me?


\q
4:
For you, God, have kept their hearts from understanding;\q therefore, you will not exalt them over me.
\q
5:
He who denounces his friends for a reward,\q the eyes of his children will fail.
\m


\q
6:
But he has made me a byword of the people;\q they spit in my face.
\q
7:
My eye is also dim because of sorrow;\q all my body parts are as thin as shadows.
\q
8:
Upright men will be stunned by this;\q the innocent man will stir himself up against godless men.


\q
9:
The righteous man will keep to his way;\q he who has clean hands will grow stronger and stronger.
\q
10:
But as for you all, come on now;\q I will not find a wise man among you.


\q
11:
My days are past; my plans are shattered,\q and so are the desires of my heart. \f + \ft Some modern versions have \fqa My days are past, as are my plans. The wishes of my heart are finished \fqa* or \fqa ... the strings of my heart have been broken \fqa* . Others have \fqa My days are past; my plans are over, as are the wishes of my heart \fqa* \f*
\q
12:
These people, these mockers, change the night into day;\q light is near to darkness.


\q
13:
If the only home I hope for is Sheol;\q and if I have spread my couch in the darkness;
\q
14:
and if I have said to the pit, 'You are my father,'\q and to the worm, 'You are my mother or my sister,'
\q
15:
where then is my hope?\q As for my hope, who can see any?


\q
16: Will hope go down with me to the gates of Sheol\q when we descend to the dust?"
